messages: 451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:31): Lachy!  How do you run Internet Explorer on Wine?
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:32): Wine is for third-party applications that are SDK-compliant;
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:32): Microsoftís applications are not SDK-compliant.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:33): <!DOCTYPE HTML> triggers HTML5 mode now in W3Cís validator.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:34): I wonder whether it is a good thing.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:34): Hixie: the marked for extraction markers have a bogus month (00)
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:36): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67! The log pages should be described as using ISO-8859-1.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:37): Internet Explorer sets the encoding to UTF-8.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:38): 451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa: why? people are supposed to speak UTF-8 here
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:40): But the logs are in ISO.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:41): So either fix the logs or tag them.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:41): The headers says Content-Type: text/html;charset=utf-8 but it is not true.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:42): Your question mark caused my computer to hang for 10 s. :-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:43): 451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa: it seems my interrobang was correctly logged as UTF-8 and served without NCRs
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:43): But look at Microsoft?s applications above.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:43): 451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa: are you sure it isn't a problem at your end with your client speaking Windows-1252 instead of UTF-8?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:44): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: if a line doesn't decode as UTF-8, you should probably decode it as Windows-1252 for robustness. That's what irssi does.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:44): How do I change the output encoding?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:46): then I don't know
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:46): 451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa: http://www.tatanka.com.br/ies4linux/page/Main_Page
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:47): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: All the status markers have bogus months (they're counting from 0 instead of 1)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:49): (Perl's localtime function is a bit unintuitive - you have to add 1 to the month and 1900 to the year)
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:51): ies4linux says: ëTons of e-mails lostedí.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:52): With a reflexive hyperlink to make it better :-)
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:52): However, ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, do you happen to know what the trick behind it would be?

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:53): 451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa: I don't think there's any particular trick - it's just IE, and Wine, and everything configured and packed together so it works
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:54): http://appdb.winehq.org/appview.php?versionId=469 describes how to make it work in regular Wine
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (14:57): Gosh, that page is unreadable.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:00): When I last used mIRC, there were two separate options you had to enable in order to make Unicode work
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:01): With irssi I only had to set one configuration option
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:01): and a command-line option
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:01): and environment variables on two computers
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:01): and recompile irssi
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:01): but then it worked fine
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:02): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67!  probably it does, and I am not surprised.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:05): was glad to see <http://browsers.evolt.org/>
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:09): And I have no idea in what encoding the logfiles are saved
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:12): It seems it decides on line-by-line basis between ISO-8859-1 and UTF-8.
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:13): That's pretty weird
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:14): Or rather CP1252 and CP65001, to be precise.
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:15): Simple solution: all of you shouldn't use any weird characters :)
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:16): loves curly quotes and non-breaking spaces
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:20): supposes mIRC just stores the bytes it got from the network
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:20): and the network probably just transmits the bytes that clients send it
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:20): so if people use stupid clients that don't send UTF-8 then you'll end up with a mixture
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:21): See also <http://validator.w3.org/check?verbose=1&uri=http%3A%2F%2Fkrijnhoetmer.nl%2Firc-logs%2Fwhatwg%2F20090222>
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:22): The raw log file: http:/ 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67oetmer.nl/zooi/whatwg.20090222.log
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:22): Oops, why did it show up in Notepad?
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:23): Anyway, publishing unverified third-party content is a mortal sin :-(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:23): http://validator.nu/?doc=http%3A%2F%2Fkrijnhoetmer.nl%2Firc-logs%2Fwhatwg%2F20090222 doesn't complain about any characters
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:23): (though you should use data-a and data-r :-) )
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:24): Sorry, I am unable to validate this document because on line 217 it contained one or more bytes that I cannot interpret as utf-8

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:25): 451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa: Publishing unverified third-party content is perfectly fine, as long as you escape '<' and don't serve it to draconian clients
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:25): You should also make sure that the character encoding is correct.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:26): ...and as long as you set the HTTP content type so people don't go all EBCDIC on you
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:26): (Er, HTTP content type charset)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:26): But then it's fine :-)
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:26): Sure, I could probably utf-8 encode each line
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:27): Add some more overhead to each request
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:29): But I think I'll stay a mortal sinner :)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:30): suggests not worrying about it - it's exactly what browser-side error correction is for :-)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:31): gsnedders: You here?
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:31): I wasn't worrying about it for 2 years now :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:32): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: not including "Now: Sun, 22 Feb 2009 15:32:21 +0100 (CET)" at the bottom of old logs would help with date-based searching
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:34): wonders if the joke "time flies like an arrow, fruit flies like a banana" can be translated into any language other than English
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:35): In Dutch it would be fruitflies

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:37): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: it's still at the top. :-) It would help to have the date of the logged day there with year, month and day as tokens that Google considers separate
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:37): You only mentioned the bottom of the page ;]
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:38): Removed as well
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (15:38): You mean something else than 20090222?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:41): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67: yeah, having 2009, 02 and 22 separated by something that google considers as a word separator
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:41): e.g. hyphen or space
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:41): You should be able to search with inurl:20090110..20090112 etc to get date ranges
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:42): except it makes Google accuse me of being a virus or spyware
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:42): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: accuses me, too. so not cool after all
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:43): today, I started to find the first IRC log mention of a firefox build with the vendor-prefixed canvas text API, but I couldn't find it
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:47): How should I mark up section date?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:47): based on grepping my offline logs
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:47): Section is H2, should the date be inside and styled away?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:47): 451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa: Why do you want to mark up section date?
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:47): Customerís requirement.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:47): He used to do it with TD :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:48): 451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa: Why do you want to do anything more complex than putting it in <span>?
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:48): The natural choice would be INS ó but that is invisible.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:48): Should the SPAN be inside the H2?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:49): Is the date a part of the section's heading?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:49): e.g. should it show up in an outline view of the document?
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:49): I think it should.
451701585f2d2833921a7b3bd274aafa (15:50): But then, the outline view would really be a TABLE, not a list :-(
